fact: There were 20 emergency airfields in Libya for Italian air operations
original_text: There were also 82 emergency fields in East Africa and 20 in Libya
notes: Infrastructure for air operations in North Africa

fact: There was one central supply depot at Tripoli supplying all Italian air units stationed in Libya
original_text: there was one central depot at Tripoli, supplying all units stationed in Libya
notes: Central logistics hub for Regia Aeronautica in Libya

fact: Three Italian armored divisions were destroyed in North Africa
original_text: Three Italian armored divisions were destroyed in North Africa
notes: Indicates scale of Italian ground operations requiring air support

fact: Italian Army gained combat experience in Libya campaign which began in 1940
original_text: the Libyan Campaign, which began in 1940
notes: Context for air operations supporting ground forces

fact: Italian production concentrated on MC.202 and MC.205 fighters among other types
source_citation: TM E 30-420, Section 276 - Aircraft industry production
original_text: Production is being concentrated on the following types: (b) MC. 202 and 205 Fighter
notes: Document is from 1943, reflects production priorities

fact: MC-200 Saetta was used in Libya operations
notes: Direct confirmation of MC-200 deployment to Libya theater
